main event: On April 7, 1960, a witness observed a bright aerial object from a radar station near Arcata, California. It was detected moving at approximately 1,000 mph before vanishing from the radar.
interesting points: The object was first detected 15 miles northeast of the radar station at an altitude of 6,000 feet., The object exhibited characteristics not associated with conventional aircraft, such as extreme speed and sudden disappearance., The witness described the object as illuminated with a bright light visible to the naked eye., The sighting lasted approximately 1 minute before the object was lost from radar., Weather conditions at the time were clear with no unusual atmospheric phenomena.
witness description: Airman First Class, stationed at the USAF RDF (Radio Direction Finding) station
